pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Prettyprint and compare Data values.
* Size limit for the output
* Time limit for the computation
* Escape exceptions
* Do not escape unicode characters
* Comparison: Highlight the first difference
* Comparison: Yes, No or Maybe results
Probably you need only the 'pprint' and '(===)' functions from the "Data.PPrint" module.
Usage examples:
> pprint [1..] > pprintTo 10000 $ repeat [1..] > pprint $ iterate (*10) 1 > pprint $ map length $ replicate 5 [1..] ++ repeat [] > pprint [2 `div` 0, error "xxx", 18, 4 `div` 0] > [1..10] === reverse [10,9..1] > [1..10] === reverse [10..1] > reverse [10..] === [1..] > [1..] === [1..99] ++ [101..] > ([1..], [1..]) === ([1..], [1..100]) > (error "x", [1..]) === (0 `div` 0, reverse [1..]) > error ("xx" ++ show (length [1..])) === 1 > error ("xx" ++ error "yy") === 1 > (error $ unlines $ replicate 300 "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx") === 1 > pprint ['a'..] > pprint $ "hello" ++ [error "x"] ++ "world!"
See also <http://pnyf.inf.elte.hu/fp/Show_en.xml>
Changes since 0.1: Refactoring, proper handling of nested errors
